00093 class TiXmlBase
00094 {
00095     friend class TiXmlNode;
00096     friend class TiXmlElement;
00097     friend class TiXmlDocument;
00098 
00099 public:
00100     TiXmlBase()                             {}
00101     virtual ~TiXmlBase()                    {}
00102 
00108     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const = 0;
00109 
00116     static void SetCondenseWhiteSpace( bool condense )      { condenseWhiteSpace = condense; }
00117 
00119     static bool IsWhiteSpaceCondensed()                     { return condenseWhiteSpace; }
00120 
00121 protected:
00122 
00123     static const char*  SkipWhiteSpace( const char* );
00124     inline static bool  IsWhiteSpace( int c )       { return ( isspace( c ) || c == '\n' || c == '\r' ); }
00125 
00126     virtual void StreamOut (TIXML_OSTREAM *) const = 0;
00127 
00128     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00129         static bool StreamWhiteSpace( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00130         static bool StreamTo( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, int character, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00131     #endif
00132 
00133     /*  Reads an XML name into the string provided. Returns
00134         a pointer just past the last character of the name,
00135         or 0 if the function has an error.
00136     */
00137     static const char* ReadName( const char* p, TIXML_STRING* name );
00138 
00139     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00140         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00141     */
00142     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00143                                     TIXML_STRING* text,         // the string read
00144                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00145                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00146                                     bool ignoreCase );          // whether to ignore case in the end tag
00147     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p ) = 0;
00148 
00149     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00150     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value );
00151 
00152     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00153     inline static const char* GetChar( const char* p, char* value )
00154     {       
00155         assert( p );
00156         if ( *p == '&' )
00157         {
00158             return GetEntity( p, value );
00159         }
00160         else
00161         {
00162             *value = *p;
00163             return p+1;
00164         }
00165     }
00166 
00167     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00168     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00169     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_OSTREAM* out );
00170 
00171     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_STRING* out );
00172 
00173     // Return true if the next characters in the stream are any of the endTag sequences.
00174     bool static StringEqual(    const char* p,
00175                                 const char* endTag,
00176                                 bool ignoreCase );
00177 
00178 
00179     enum
00180     {
00181         TIXML_NO_ERROR = 0,
00182         TIXML_ERROR,
00183         TIXML_ERROR_OPENING_FILE,
00184         TIXML_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY,
00185         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_ELEMENT,
00186         TIXML_ERROR_FAILED_TO_READ_ELEMENT_NAME,
00187         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ELEMENT_VALUE,
00188         TIXML_ERROR_READING_ATTRIBUTES,
00189         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_EMPTY,
00190         TIXML_ERROR_READING_END_TAG,
00191         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_UNKNOWN,
00192         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_COMMENT,
00193         TIXML_ERROR_PARSING_DECLARATION,
00194         TIXML_ERROR_DOCUMENT_EMPTY,
00195 
00196         TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT
00197     };
00198     static const char* errorString[ TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT ];
00199 
00200 private:
00201     struct Entity
00202     {
00203         const char*     str;
00204         unsigned int    strLength;
00205         int             chr;
00206     };
00207     enum
00208     {
00209         NUM_ENTITY = 5,
00210         MAX_ENTITY_LENGTH = 6
00211 
00212     };
00213     static Entity entity[ NUM_ENTITY ];
00214     static bool condenseWhiteSpace;
00215 };

00224 class TiXmlNode : public TiXmlBase
00225 {

00228 
00229 public:
00230     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL    
00231

00236 
00252         friend std::ostream & operator<< (std::ostream& out, const TiXmlNode& base);
00253 
00254     #else
00255         // Used internally, not part of the public API.
00256         friend TIXML_OSTREAM& operator<< (TIXML_OSTREAM& out, const TiXmlNode& base);
00257     #endif
00258 
00262     enum NodeType
00263     {
00264         DOCUMENT,
00265         ELEMENT,
00266         COMMENT,
00267         UNKNOWN,
00268         TEXT,
00269         DECLARATION,
00270         TYPECOUNT
00271     };
00272

00274

00418     TiXmlDocument* GetDocument() const;

00421     bool NoChildren() const                     { return !firstChild; }
00422 
00423     TiXmlDocument* ToDocument() const       { return ( this && type == DOCUMENT ) ? (TiXmlDocument*) this : 0; } 
00424     TiXmlElement*  ToElement() const        { return ( this && type == ELEMENT  ) ? (TiXmlElement*)  this : 0; } 
00425     TiXmlComment*  ToComment() const        { return ( this && type == COMMENT  ) ? (TiXmlComment*)  this : 0; } 
00426     TiXmlUnknown*  ToUnknown() const        { return ( this && type == UNKNOWN  ) ? (TiXmlUnknown*)  this : 0; } 
00427     TiXmlText*     ToText()    const        { return ( this && type == TEXT     ) ? (TiXmlText*)     this : 0; } 
00428     TiXmlDeclaration* ToDeclaration() const { return ( this && type == DECLARATION ) ? (TiXmlDeclaration*) this : 0; } 
00429

00438     #endif
00439 
00440     // The node is passed in by ownership. This object will delete it.
00441     TiXmlNode* LinkEndChild( TiXmlNode* addThis );
00442

00444     TiXmlNode* Identify( const char* start );

00446 
00447     // Internal Value function returning a TIXML_STRING
00448     TIXML_STRING SValue() const { return value ; }

00472 class TiXmlAttribute : public TiXmlBase
00473 {
00474     friend class TiXmlAttributeSet;
00475 
00476 public:
00478     TiXmlAttribute() : prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00479 
00480     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00481 
00482     TiXmlAttribute( const std::string& _name, const std::string& _value )
00483     {
00484         name = _name . c_str ();
00485         value = _value . c_str ();
00486     }
00487     #endif
00488 
00490     TiXmlAttribute( const char * _name, const char * _value ): name( _name ), value( _value ), prev( 0 ), next( 0 ) {}
00491     const char*     Name()  const       { return name.c_str (); }       
00492     const char*     Value() const       { return value.c_str (); }      
00493     const int       IntValue() const;                                   
00494     const double    DoubleValue() const;                                
00495 
00496     void SetName( const char* _name )   { name = _name; }               
00497     void SetValue( const char* _value ) { value = _value; }             
00498 
00499     void SetIntValue( int value );                                      
00500     void SetDoubleValue( double value );                                
00501 
00502     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00503     void SetName( const std::string& _name )    {   SetName (_name . c_str ()); }   
00504     void SetValue( const std::string& _value )  {   SetValue (_value . c_str ());   }   
00505     #endif
00506 
00508     TiXmlAttribute* Next() const;
00510     TiXmlAttribute* Previous() const;
00511 
00512     bool operator==( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs ) const { return rhs.name == name; }
00513     bool operator<( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name < rhs.name; }
00514     bool operator>( const TiXmlAttribute& rhs )  const { return name > rhs.name; }
00515 
00516     /*  [internal use]
00517         Attribtue parsing starts: first letter of the name
00518                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00519     */
00520     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00521 
00522     // [internal use]
00523     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00524 
00525     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00526     // [internal use]
00527     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00528     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00529 
00530 private:
00531     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00532     TIXML_STRING name;
00533     TIXML_STRING value;
00534     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00535     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00536 };
00537 
00538 
00539 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00540     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00541     
00542     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00543     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute
00544     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00545     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00546 
00547     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00548         - I like circular lists
00549         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00550 */
00551 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00552 {
00553 public:
00554     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00555     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00556 
00557     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00558     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00559 
00560     TiXmlAttribute* First() const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00561     TiXmlAttribute* Last()  const   { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00562     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const char * name ) const;
00563 
00564 private:
00565     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00566 };
00567 
00568 
00573 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00574 {
00575 public:
00577     TiXmlElement (const char * in_value);
00578 
00579     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00580 
00581     TiXmlElement( const std::string& _value ) :     TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::ELEMENT )
00582     {
00583         firstChild = lastChild = 0;
00584         value = _value . c_str ();
00585     }
00586     #endif
00587 
00588     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00589 
00593     const char * Attribute( const char * name ) const;
00594 
00598     const char * Attribute( const char * name, int & i ) const;
00599 
00603     void SetAttribute( const char * name, const char * value );
00604 
00605     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00606     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, const std::string& value )  {   SetAttribute (name . c_str (), value . c_str ());   }   
00607     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, int value ) {   SetAttribute (name . c_str (), value);  }   
00608     #endif
00609 
00613     void SetAttribute( const char * name, int value );
00614 
00617     void RemoveAttribute( const char * name );
00618     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00619     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name ) {   RemoveAttribute (name . c_str ());  }   
00620     #endif
00621 
00622     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute() const  { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00623     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute() const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00624 
00625     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00626     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00627     // [internal use]
00628 
00629     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00630 
00631 protected:
00632 
00633     // Used to be public [internal use]
00634     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00635         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00636     #endif
00637     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00638 
00639     /*  [internal use]
00640         Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00641                          returns: next char past '>'
00642     */
00643     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00644 
00645     /*  [internal use]
00646         Reads the "value" of the element -- another element, or text.
00647         This should terminate with the current end tag.
00648     */
00649     const char* ReadValue( const char* in );
00650 
00651 private:
00652     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
00653 };

00658 class TiXmlComment : public TiXmlNode

00662     TiXmlComment() : TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::COMMENT ) {}
00663     virtual ~TiXmlComment() {}
00664

00666     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;

00668     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00669 protected:
00670     // used to be public
00671     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00672         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00673     #endif
00674     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00675     /*  [internal use]
00676         Attribtue parsing starts: at the ! of the !--
00677                          returns: next char past '>'
00678     */
00679     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p );
00680 };

00756                                         const char * _encoding,

00784

00882     void ClearError()                       { error = false; errorId = 0; errorDesc = ""; }
00883 
00885     void Print() const                              { Print( stdout, 0 ); }
00886 
00887     // [internal use]
00888     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth = 0 ) const;
00889     // [internal use]
00890     void SetError( int err ) {      assert( err > 0 && err < TIXML_ERROR_STRING_COUNT );
00891         error   = true;
00892         errorId = err;
00893     errorDesc = errorString[ errorId ]; }
00894 
00895 protected :
00896     virtual void StreamOut ( TIXML_OSTREAM * out) const;
00897     // [internal use]
00898     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00899     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00900         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00901     #endif
00902 
00903 private:
00904     bool error;
00905     int  errorId;
00906     TIXML_STRING errorDesc;
00907 };
